rev.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/67.180.198.177|67.180.198.177]] to last revision by Versus22 ([[WP:HG|HG]])
/* Criticism and controversy */ This section is not in line with two settled arbitrations, is not a dispassinate representation of facts, and cites articles and authors who have been later refuted.
/* Raising of funds */ This section is irrelevant to the historical person Sathya Sai Baba - if wiki-worthy at all, it is better placed in the section associated with the Sai organization.

brief summation of Sai Baba's teachings

minor additions to practices of devotees

Terry Gallagher letter to the Bailey's cited in the BBC documentary "Secret Swami" had the facts wrong.
removed reference to several documentaries with sexual allegations since the 60s; the documentaries that this person sites were not released until after 2000.
added that the aforecited reference by the US State Department was removed on July 17, 2007.
added prime minister of india letter 2001 with regard to BBC Secret Swami documentary
/* Reports of materialization and other miracles */
/* Ashrams and mandirs */ Minor style-related edits.

Don't disrupt this article adding Priddy as a reference again. Arbitration commitee passed a ruling saying Priddy cannot be used. If you have a problem with that please discuss in the talk page first.

Moving finance section to criticism, this is not about their teachings

moving and rename miracles section to "reports of materialization" in criticism
/* Reports of homosexual abuse */ I'm not one for political correctness, but the right term to use here is "sexual abuse"

/* Purported miracles */ rm unsourced embellishment, consolidate info from paras, copyedit
/* Purported miracles */ mv to documentaries para, rm direct link to video, c/e
/* Purported "miracles" */ no need for quotation in title, the word "purported" does the job
/* Purported "miracles" */ shorten, rmed a source which wasn't english--it didn't add very much to the criticism, as a tertiary source
/* Purported "miracles" */ copyediting, and general tone down.
/* Purported "miracles" */ Lets cut down on verbosity here. All of this can be said with fewer words. Also corrected nationality
/* Purported "miracles" */ c/e, removing source which no longer exists
Adding a bit more relevant info on the resurrection claim stuff. Commentary would provide genreic insight into the nature of purported miracles as percieved by sources such as The BC Skeptics
/* Purported "miracles" */ consolidated claims of spontaneous objects appearing, reduced to two best sources (published in print), c/e
/* Murders in ashram */ rmv. not notable . blp.
/* Corroborative Reports */ rm non reliable source, original research
/* Purported "miracles" */ cut down on unnecessary verbosity
/* Purported "miracles" */ rm deadlink, rm non-RS youtube link
/* Discrepancies */ entire section is a copyvio of http://robertpriddy.wordpress.com/2007/05/23/sathya-sai-baba-bedroom-murders-part-2/
/* Discrepancies */ removing blogs as improper sources ([[WP:SPS|self-published sources]])
/* Biography */ rm primary source, add cn
/* Biography */ move full-stop, rm primary source
/* Biography */ rm primary sources, fix ref
Date maintenance tags and general fixes
/* Biography */ rm unreliable source, which contained only pictures
/* Teachings */ comment coming from within the organization is non-academic and misleading - kindly correct me if am wrong.
/* Biography */ there is a semantic difference between 'murdered' and 'died' - fixing the percieved factual mistake
/* Biography */ undo splitting of para, paraphrase quote, fix ref
/* Biography */ Just to point out that this is not a BLP violation - is rather central to the person's notability in international media.
/* Biography */ c/e, fix ref, split para
/* Biography */ rm unsourced insignificant account, add space

rename section to "biography" (was "early life"), replace with english word, moved section about the man himself to his biography section

/* Ashrams and mandirs */ rm possible promotion from primary source, and a deadlink
/* Ashrams and mandirs */ rm ref whitespace, neutralize sentence, rm trivia about travel habits of Sathya
/* Early life */ unsourced BLP violation, interlaced with POV-related accusations
/* Early life */ Qualifying the source.. we must keep in mind and also make clear to the reader that little is objective info is there other than conflicting claims from devotees.
/* Early life */ commenting out broken link, adding cn
/* Early life */ removing direct quote which adds little quality to the article
/* Early life */ add cn, reposition ref, grammar, remove unnecessary loaded lead-in words
That is what the whole BBC documentary was indeed about. The video is available on youtube. Added a related article from "The Times", London as supporting source.
Removing material not supported by documentary synopsis provided, in accordance with [[WP:BLP]] policy (see [[WP:GRAPEVINE]]). Please source properly before re-adding
The BBC synopsis does not state this. If the BBC documentary truly does make this claim, please cite using the {{cite video}} template
Only one citation needed for this sentence.
